intro: Vincetoxicum hirundinaria subsp. intermedium, commonly known as the European dog's mercury, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Vincetoxicum.
